sen.j: 日本紀講筵（にほんぎこうえん）とは、平安時代前期に国史である『日本書紀』の講義・研究を行う宮中行事。
sen.e: Nihongi Koen was a court function that gave lectures and did researches on the national history of Japan or "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) in the early Heian Period.

sen.j: 721年（養老5年）に最初の講筵に行われたが、これは『日本書紀』完成を祝したものと考えられ、後世のものとやや趣が異なっていると見られる。
sen.e: The first Nihongi Koen was held in 721, but it presumed to have had slightly different characters from those of the later years because it is thought to have held in celebration for the completion of the "Nihonshoki".

sen.e: The functions are known to have been held seven times after that, in 812, 843, 878, 904, 936 and 965.

sen.j: 講師には紀伝道などの歴史に通じた学者が博士・都講・尚復などに任命された。
sen.e: Scholars conversant with history such as Kidendo (the study of the histories) were appointed as instructors called hakase (an expert), toko and shofuku (reviewers at the post who reviews a book offered by the lecturer for the Emperor or Crown Prince at the ceremony of Emperor's first reading).

sen.j: 彼らは、数年かけて全30巻の講義を行った。
